result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Dontre R Paige in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Dontre R Paige.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status conference on status of counsel.  Attorney Webb has been recently been retained by the Defendant.  Defense has received digital discovery, but still needs paper discovery and an offer from the state and requests adjourned scheduling conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dontre R Paige in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Gregory.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 17.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Sargent in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
